lol maokai cant one shot you with E

The highest win-rate build in the picture ({{item:3151}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3092}} {{item:3089}} ) gives 80 + 100 + 100 + 60 + 120 AP = 460 AP \* 1.35 = 621 AP

Saplings deal a total of 290 + 16% targets max health + 4% targets max health per 100 AP = 290 + 40% HP per E with that build

So 2 E's in a bush = 80% HP + 580 magic damage

If you assume Maokai's target is an ADC who didn't grab any extra health or MR (I'll use Jinx for my numbers) then they'll take (100 / (100 + 38.5 - 30)) = 92% of that damage. 

* 1912 HP \* 80% = 1530 damage \* 92% = 1,407 damage. 
* 580 damage \* 92% = 534 damage.

534 + 1530 = 2064 > 1912 = dead ADC. And that's without counting additional burn from {{item:3151}} or the {{item:3285}} proc.
ok so if he builds full ap as a support and spends 16800 in ap items

He can max his E by level 9. At that point, the ADC has 1070 HP, and we'll assume that Maokai has {{item:3092}} {{item:3020}} {{item:1052}} and 20 AP from Runes and Masteries (for a total of 100 AP). Again, 2 saplings in a bush. 

(100 / (100 + 33.4 - 15)) = 84.5% damage taken
580 damage \* 84.5% = 490 damage taken
1070 HP \* 40% HP =  428 damage taken

490 + 428 = 918 damage dealt
Health Remaining = 152 HP

Yeah it's not 100-0, but it's close enough that you can bet this "support" is going to be picking up a few kills and a lot of assists, especially if he can use another ability.
well yea but how viable to you see a full ap maokai being if there is no other front line on team... it would be to easy to focus and blow him up if he was full ap

> well yea but how viable to you see a full ap maokai being if there is no other front line on team... 

In theory, just as viable as full AP Zyra, Malzahar, or Brand on a team with no other front line on the team. None of these champions are *trying* to be the front line of their team, let someone else handle that. 

I don't think you'd use him for diving into the front line, but rather as zone control. If the enemy team can't even start walking towards Baron or Dragon or their own Blue/Red buffs without loosing a member or having to return to base, how long do you think they're going to hold out? If your Jungler is an Ivern, then they'd have to back away from turrets too. 

I don't know if it'll become meta, but I do suspect that it'll get nerfed.

The most common build grabs {{item:2301}} , but in any case I'm sure they're essentially using Saplings in the same way Teemo uses Mushrooms - both to grant vision around them and to get a global announcement that some fool tried coming that way.

As someone who practically mains Teemo, this does not bother me.  Trap champs are only problematic if there's no way to avoid their traps at all.

How about this for a change?  "Targets struck by one sapling take no additional damage from other sapling detonations, it only refreshes the duration of the DoT if the sapling was in a bush"?  Just like a teemo shroom, he can't stack a ton on top of each other and one-shot carries with an AP build.  They still hurt, but they're just bush-wards, not bush-nukes.

The *systems* work that gets done during class updates tends to be great. The champion work tends to be good at fixing one problem but then creates a new one, so it ends up being not a great use of time. I'd rather see 1-2 champions get the attention they deserve, and leave the rest to live gameplay (balance) until champup has a chance to get around to them.
